component.text: The first World IPv6 Day (June 8, 2011), many websites and Internet service providers around the world, including Google, Facebook, and Yahoo!, participated with more than 1,000 other companies for a worldwide trial of IPv6.
The first specifications for IPv6 (the eventual successor to IPv4) released (RFC 1883).
The first web browser, MOSAIC, is developed by Marc Andreessen at the University of Illinois, Champaign-Urbana.

1985_x2 Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce id lacus in risus consectetur tristique. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce id lacus in risus consectetur tristique.
Tim Berners-Lee and Robert Cailliau release the specifications for WWW.
The Internet Relay Chat (IRC) is developed by Jarkko Oikarinen.
Network

Enrico: Hi Jessica!
Jessica: Hi Enrico!

Enrico: Hi Jessica!
Jessica: Hi Enrico!
1986 - Cisco launches its first routing innovation, the AGS multi-protocol router.
The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is documented (RFC 765).
The Domain Name Service (DNS) is introduced.
Network
DNS server
What is the IP address for www.example.com?
The IP address for www.example.com is 10.10.10.10.
Client
The Exterior Gateway Protocol (EGP) is developed to allow routers to exchange network information (RFC 827).
EGP
EGP
EGP
The TCP and IP protocols are formalized (RFC 793 and RFC 791).
Ray Tomlinson chooses the @ sign to signify the recipient’s destination.
Larry Roberts writes the first email management program.
Telnet specification written (RFC 318).
Remote File Server

C> telnet 10.1.1.1
Login: ****
Password: ****

Connected to Remote File Server
ALOHAnet becomes operational, the first packet radio network, developed by Norman Abramson, University of Hawaii.

On October 29, 1969, the first message is transmitted from an SDS Sigma 7 mainframe computer at University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) to an SDS 940 mainframe computer at Stanford Research Institute.
